newsitem.title: GREECE: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 14.75PCT.
newsitem.headline: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 14.75PCT.

text.p: Greece's Alpha Credit Bank said its prime rate for working capital and fixed asset loans will remain unchanged at 14.75 percent.
Alpha Credit, which reviews its rates weekly, said the maximum add-on would remain unchanged at 3.5 percent.
Its adjustable-rate mortgages will be steady at 15.0 percent.

The bank launched 15-year mortgages in October 1995 with rates set at 12.0 percent for the first five years. Rates on these mortgages have been reduced to 11.50 percent. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
